plugin.name: Apache Karaf :: Tooling :: Maven Karaf Plugin
plugin.description: The Apache Software Foundation provides support for the Apache community of open-source software projects. The Apache projects are characterized by a collaborative, consensus based development process, an open and pragmatic software license, and a desire to create high quality software that leads the way in its field. We consider ourselves not simply a group of projects sharing a server, but rather a community of developers and users.

mojo.description: Package a server archive from an assembled server

parameter.name: archiveTarGz
parameter.description: pack a assembly as a tar.gz archive

parameter.name: archiveZip
parameter.description: pack a assembly as a zip archive

parameter.name: destDir
parameter.description: The target directory of the project.

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: pathPrefix
parameter.description: Path prefix of files in the created archive.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: targetFile
parameter.description: The target file to set as the project's artifact.

parameter.name: targetServerDirectory
parameter.description: The location of the server repository.

parameter.name: usePathPrefix
parameter.description: Use a path prefix of files in the created archive

parameter.name: useSymLinks
parameter.description:
use symbolic links in tar.gz or zip archives
Symbolic links are not very well supported by windows Platform. At least, is does not work on WinXP + NTFS, so do not include them for now. So the default is false.

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Directory that resources are copied to during the build.

mojo.description: Installs kar dependencies into a server-under-construction in target/assembly

parameter.name: bootFeatures
parameter.description: List of features from runtime-scope features xml and kars to be installed into system repo and listed in features service boot features.

parameter.name: defaultStartLevel
parameter.description: default start level for bundles in features that don't specify it.

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: featureRepositories
parameter.description: Additional feature repositories

parameter.name: featuresCfgFile
parameter.description: Features configuration file (etc/org.apache.karaf.features.cfg).

parameter.name: ignoreDependencyFlag
parameter.description: Ignore the dependency attribute (dependency="[true|false]") on bundle

parameter.name: includeBuildOutputDirectory
parameter.description: Include project build output directory in the assembly

parameter.name: installedFeatures
parameter.description: List of features from runtime-scope features xml and kars to be installed into system repo and not mentioned elsewhere.

parameter.name: javase
parameter.description: Specify the version of Java SE to be assumed for osgi.ee.

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: startupFeatures
parameter.description: List of features from runtime-scope features xml and kars to be installed into system and listed in startup.properties.

parameter.name: startupPropertiesFile
parameter.description: startup.properties file.

parameter.name: systemDirectory
parameter.description: Directory used during build to construction the Karaf system repository.

parameter.name: useReferenceUrls
parameter.description: Use reference: style urls in startup.properties

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Base directory used to copy the resources during the build (working directory).

mojo.description: Generates help documentation for Karaf commands

parameter.name: classLoader
parameter.description: The classloader to use for loading the commands. Can be "project" or "plugin"

parameter.name: format
parameter.description: The output format

parameter.name: includeHelpOption
parameter.description: Includes the --help command output in the generated documentation

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The maven project.

parameter.name: targetFolder
parameter.description: The output folder

mojo.description: Add features to a repository directory

parameter.name: defaultStartLevel
parameter.description: The start level exported when no explicit start level is set for a bundle

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: flatRepoLayout
parameter.description: If set to true the exported bundles will be directly copied into the repository dir. If set to false the default maven repository layout will be used

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Directory that resources are copied to during the build.

parameter.name: defaultStartLevel
parameter.description: The start level exported when no explicit start level is set for a bundle

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: mergedFeature
parameter.description: If set to true then all bundles will be merged into one combined feature. In this case duplicates will be eliminated

parameter.name: metaDataFile
parameter.description: Name of the file for exported feature meta data

parameter.name: oneVersion
parameter.description: If set to true then for each bundle symbolic name only the highest version will be used

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Directory that resources are copied to during the build.

mojo.description:
Generates the features XML file starting with an optional source feature.xml and adding project dependencies as bundles and feature/car dependencies.
NB this requires a recent maven-install-plugin such as 2.3.1

parameter.name: addBundlesToPrimaryFeature
parameter.description:
The standard behavior is to add dependencies as <bundle> elements to a <feature> with the same name as the artifactId of the project. This flag disables that behavior. If this parameter is true, then two other parameters refine the list of bundles added to the primary feature: excludedArtifactIds and ignoreScopeProvided. Each of these specifies dependent artifacts that should not be added to the primary feature.

Note that you may tune the bundle elements by including them in the inputFile. If the inputFile has a feature element for the primary feature, the plugin will respect it, so that you can, for example, set the startLevel or start attribute.

parameter.name: aggregateFeatures
parameter.description: Specifies whether features dependencies of this project will be included inline in the final output (true), or simply referenced as output artifact dependencies (false). If true, feature dependencies' xml descriptors are read and their contents added to the features descriptor under assembly. If false, feature dependencies are added to the assembled feature as dependencies. Setting this value to true is especially helpful in multiproject builds where subprojects build their own features using aggregateFeatures = false, then combined with aggregateFeatures = true in an aggregation project with explicit dependencies to the child projects.

parameter.name: attachmentArtifactClassifier
parameter.description: (wrapper) The artifact classifier for attaching the generated file to the project

parameter.name: attachmentArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type for attaching the generated file to the project

parameter.name: checkDependencyChange
parameter.description: Master switch to look for and log changed dependencies. If this is set to true and the file referenced by dependencyCache does not exist, it will be unconditionally generated. If the file does exist, it is used to detect changes from previous builds and generate logs of those changes. In that case, failOnDependencyChange = true will cause the build to fail.

parameter.name: dependencyCache
parameter.description: (wrapper) Location of dependency cache. This file is generated to contain known dependencies and is generally located in SCM so that it may be used across separate developer builds. This is parameter is ignored unless checkDependencyChange is set to true.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: The character encoding scheme to be applied when filtering resources.

parameter.name: escapeString
parameter.description: Expression preceded with the String won't be interpolated \${foo} will be replaced with ${foo}

parameter.name: excludedArtifactIds
parameter.description: Exclude some artifacts from the generated feature. See addBundlesToPrimaryFeature for more details.

parameter.name: failOnDependencyChange
parameter.description: Whether to fail on changed dependencies (default, true) or warn (false). This is parameter is ignored unless checkDependencyChange is set to true and dependencyCache exists to compare against.

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: filteredDependencyCache
parameter.description: Location of filtered dependency file.

parameter.name: filteredInputFile
parameter.description: (wrapper) The filtered input file. This file holds the result of Maven resource interpolation and is generally not necessary to change, although it may be helpful for debugging.

parameter.name: ignoreScopeProvided
parameter.description: The standard behavior is to add any dependencies other than those in the runtime scope to the feature bundle. Setting this flag to "true" disables adding any dependencies (transient or otherwise) that are in <scope>provided</scope>. See addBundlesToPrimaryFeature for more details.

parameter.name: includeProjectArtifact
parameter.description:
Flag indicating whether the main project artifact should be included (true) or not (false). This parameter is useful when you add an execution of this plugin to a project with some packaging that is not feature. If you don't set this, then you will get a feature that contains the dependencies but not the primary artifact itself.

Assumes the main project artifact is a bundle and the feature will be attached alongside using attachmentArtifactClassifier.

parameter.name: includeTransitiveDependency
parameter.description:
Flag indicating whether transitive dependencies should be included (true) or not (false).

N.B. Note the default value of this is true, but is suboptimal in cases where specific <feature/> dependencies are provided by the inputFile parameter.

parameter.name: inputFile
parameter.description:
An (optional) input feature file to extend. The plugin reads this file, and uses it as a template to create the output. This is highly recommended as it is the only way to add <feature/> elements to the individual features that are generated. Note that this file is filtered using standard Maven resource interpolation, allowing attributes of the input file to be set with information such as ${project.version} from the current build.

When dependencies are processed, if they are duplicated in this file, the dependency here provides the baseline information and is supplemented by additional information from the dependency.

parameter.name: installMode
parameter.description:
Installation mode. If present, generate "feature.install" attribute:

Installation mode

Can be either manual or auto. Specifies whether the feature should be automatically installed when dropped inside the deploy folder. Note: this attribute doesn't affect feature descriptors that are installed from the feature:install command or as part of the etc/org.apache.karaf.features.cfg file.

parameter.name: logDependencyChanges
parameter.description: Copies the contents of dependency change logs that are generated to stdout. This is parameter is ignored unless checkDependencyChange is set to true and dependencyCache exists to compare against.

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: outputFile
parameter.description: The file to generate. This file is attached as a project output artifact with the classifier specified by attachmentArtifactClassifier.

parameter.name: overwriteChangedDependencies
parameter.description: Whether to overwrite the file referenced by dependencyCache if it has changed. This is parameter is ignored unless checkDependencyChange is set to true, failOnDependencyChange is set to false and dependencyCache exists to compare against.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: resolver
parameter.description: The resolver to use for the feature. Normally null or "OBR" or "(OBR)"

parameter.name: startLevel
parameter.description: If present, the bundles added to the feature constructed from the dependencies will be marked with this default startlevel. If this parameter is not present, no startlevel attribute will be created. Finer resolution for specific dependencies can be obtained by specifying the dependency in the file referenced by the inputFile parameter.

parameter.name: systemProperties
parameter.description: System properties.

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Directory that resources are copied to during the build.

mojo.description: Assemble a kar archive from a features.xml file

parameter.name: archive
parameter.description:
The maven archive configuration to use.

See the Javadocs for MavenArchiveConfiguration.

parameter.name: classifier
parameter.description: Classifier to add to the artifact generated. If given, the artifact will be attached. If it's not given, it will merely be written to the output directory according to the finalName.

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: featuresFile
parameter.description: The features file to use as instructions

parameter.name: finalName
parameter.description: Name of the generated archive.

parameter.name: ignoreDependencyFlag
parameter.description: Ignore the dependency flag on the bundles in the features XML

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Directory containing the generated archive.

parameter.name: project
parameter.description: The Maven project.

parameter.name: repositoryPath
parameter.description: The wrapper repository in the kar.

parameter.name: resourcesDir
parameter.description: Location of resources directory for additional content to include in the kar. Note that it includes everything under classes so as to include maven-remote-resources

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Directory that resources are copied to during the build.

parameter.name: featureArtifactType
parameter.description: The artifact type of a feature.

parameter.name: mavenSession
parameter.description: The Maven session.

parameter.name: workDirectory
parameter.description: Directory that resources are copied to during the build.
